terms.definition: Standard Operating Procedure - a documented set of step-by-step instructions that describe how to perform routine tasks consistently and safely
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and revert to previous versions
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
Quality Assurance - the systematic process of ensuring that products or services meet specified requirements and standards
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted remotely and accessed via the internet
A chronological record of system activities that provides documentary evidence of the sequence of activities that have affected a specific operation or event
Formal records and documents that demonstrate adherence to regulatory requirements, industry standards, and internal policies
Immediate synchronization of changes across all users and systems as soon as modifications are made to documents or data
The coordinated effort between different organizational departments to share information, resources, and expertise toward common goals
A systematic problem-solving methodology used to identify the underlying causes of defects or issues rather than just addressing symptoms

An international standard that specifies requirements for a quality management system to demonstrate an organization's ability to consistently provide products that meet customer and regulatory requirements
A single, unified storage location where all documents, files, and data are stored and managed, providing a single source of truth
The process of making documents accessible to multiple users simultaneously, often with controlled permissions and real-time collaboration features
Quantifiable measures used to track and assess the quality of products, processes, or services over time
International Railway Industry Standard - a quality management system standard specifically designed for the railway industry supply chain
